title: compiler panic while cross-compiling any code

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
Hi

I'm cross-compiling to l4re, hence I built rustc using `x.py --target=x86_64-unknown-l4re-uclibc --host=x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu` and invoked
rustc with `--target=x86_64-unknown-l4re-uclibc`. When compiling arbitrary code, I get
an error like this:

```
thread 'main' panicked at 'slice index starts at 42783471 but ends at 4459779', libcore/slice/mod.rs:1977:5
stack backtrace:
   0: std::sys::unix::backtrace::tracing::imp::unwind_backtrace
   1: std::sys_common::backtrace::print
   2: std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}}
   3: std::panicking::default_hook
   4: rustc::util::common::panic_hook
   5: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook
   6: std::panicking::continue_panic_fmt
   7: rust_begin_unwind
   8: core::panicking::panic_fmt
   9: core::slice::slice_index_order_fail
  10: rustc_metadata::decoder::__ty_decoder_impl::<impl serialize::serialize::Decoder for rustc_metadata::decoder::DecodeContext<'a, 'tcx>>::read_usize
  11: serialize::serialize::Decoder::read_enum
  12: serialize::serialize::Decoder::read_struct
  13: rustc_metadata::decoder::<impl rustc_metadata::schema::Lazy<T>>::decode
  14: rustc_metadata::cstore_impl::<impl rustc::middle::cstore::CrateStore for rustc_metadata::cstore::CStore>::item_children_untracked
  15: rustc_resolve::build_reduced_graph::<impl rustc_resolve::Resolver<'a>>::populate_module_if_necessary
  16: rustc_resolve::build_reduced_graph::<impl rustc_resolve::Resolver<'a>>::build_reduced_graph_for_item
  17: <rustc_resolve::build_reduced_graph::BuildReducedGraphVisitor<'a, 'b> as syntax::visit::Visitor<'a>>::visit_item
  18: syntax::visit::walk_item
  19: <rustc_resolve::build_reduced_graph::BuildReducedGraphVisitor<'a, 'b> as syntax::visit::Visitor<'a>>::visit_item
  20: syntax::ext::expand::AstFragment::visit_with
  21: rustc_resolve::macros::<impl syntax::ext::base::Resolver for rustc_resolve::Resolver<'a>>::visit_ast_fragment_with_placeholders
  22: syntax::ext::expand::MacroExpander::collect_invocations
  23: syntax::ext::expand::MacroExpander::expand_fragment
  24: syntax::ext::expand::MacroExpander::expand_crate
  25: rustc_driver::driver::phase_2_configure_and_expand_inner::{{closure}}
  26: rustc::util::common::time
  27: rustc_driver::driver::phase_2_configure_and_expand
  28: rustc_driver::driver::compile_input
  29: rustc_driver::run_compiler_with_pool
  30: <scoped_tls::ScopedKey<T>>::set
  31: <scoped_tls::ScopedKey<T>>::set
  32: syntax::with_globals
  33: <std::panic::AssertUnwindSafe<F> as core::ops::function::FnOnce<()>>::call_once
  34: __rust_maybe_catch_panic
  35: rustc_driver::run
  36: rustc_driver::main
  37: std::rt::lang_start::{{closure}}
  38: std::panicking::try::do_call
  39: __rust_maybe_catch_panic
  40: std::rt::lang_start_internal
  41: main
  42: __libc_start_main
  43: _start

query stack during panic:
end of query stack

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: rustc 1.29.0-dev running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
note: compiler flags: -C opt-level=1 --crate-type staticlib
```

Thanks
